poem:
Summer Ascendant

Standing by the window,
each blade of grass 
cries out, parched.

The heat—a relentless hand— 
tightens its grip.

Across states,
from New York whispers 
to Los Angeles roars,

the sun's fire brands its mark
on our summers, 
searing history 
into skin and soil.

Sweat beads and time melts—
we remember coolness 
as a distant dream.
